intro: Lomatium bicolor, commonly known as the twinleaf lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Lomatium bicolor thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
